175.article_body: A video shared by photographer Viral Bhayani shows actor Varun Dhawan posing with a specially-abled fan for pictures. In the video, the fan can also be seen hugging Varun and giving a peck on his cheek. Reacting to the video, a fan wrote, "Varun is one of the kindest actors in Bollywood," while another fan wrote, "This made my day."

176.title: Russia blows up bridge linking Ukraine's Sievierodonetsk city
176.article_body: The Russian forces blew up a bridge connecting Ukraine's Sievierodonetsk to another city across the river, said local officials on Sunday. This has cut off a possible route for evacuation of civilians, they added. "About 500 civilians remain on the territory of the Azot plant in Sievierodonetsk, 40 of them are children," said Luhansk Governor Serhiy Gaidai.

177.title: Man loses control of 2-wheeler, hits 2 women; Cyberabad Police retweet video
177.article_body: The Cyberabad Police retweeted a video, shared by the Medak District Police, of a man driving a two-wheeler. The man can be seen losing control of the vehicle and hitting two women who were walking on the side of the road. Towards the end of the video, the man can be seen lying on the road after the accident.

178.title: Satyendar Jain sent to 14-day judicial custody in alleged money laundering case
178.article_body: The Rouse Avenue court in Delhi on Monday sent AAP leader and Delhi minister Satyendar Jain to 14-day judicial custody in an alleged money laundering case. Earlier, the Enforcement Directorate said it recovered ₹2.85 crore in cash and 133 gold coins after conducting raids on Jain and his associates. Jain was arrested by the Enforcement Directorate on May 30.

179.title: Undeclared emergency in Delhi: Surjewala ahead of Rahul's ED appearance
179.article_body: Ahead of Congress leader Rahul Gandhi’s appearance before the ED in Delhi on Monday, party leader Randeep Singh Surjewala said "coward" PM Narendra Modi-led government has imposed an undeclared emergency in Central Delhi. "The coward Modi government has deployed many police barriers and police personnel…This proves that the Modi government is shaken by Congress," Surjewala added.

180.title: Over 4,000 International Driving Permits issued to Delhi residents since Feb
180.article_body: The Delhi transport department has issued 4,286 International Driving Permits (IDP) from February till June 7, 2022. According to the data, 1,150 were given for the United States and 986 were given for Canada in 2022, followed by Great Britain (442) and the UAE (335). Notably, 439 IDPs were issued in June to residents of Delhi who had moved abroad.

181.title: Twitter user posts video of man stealing scooter in Hyd, tags police
181.article_body: A Twitter user shared a video of a man stealing a scooter from a street in Hyderabad. While tagging Hyderabad Police, the user wrote, "Sir, One Activa bike...was stolen from Shahalibanda new road...on 12th June under...@shohussainialam...kindly put some special teams to recover this bike as soon as possible as till now no FIR has been issued."

182.title: Mr Bean was self-centred, narcissistic anarchist: Rowan Atkinson
182.article_body: British actor Rowan Atkinson, speaking about his character Mr Bean, has said that the character was a "self-centred, narcissistic anarchist". Rowan will be playing Trevor in his upcoming series 'Man Vs Bee'. While comparing Trevor to Mr Bean, Rowan said, "Trevor is different. He is a much nicer and much sweeter and more normal person."

183.title: BJP's cronyism has crossed Palk Strait: Rahul on power project claim
183.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Sunday said BJP’s "cronyism" has crossed Palk Strait and moved into Sri Lanka. His statement came after a top Sri Lankan official claimed that PM Narendra Modi "pressured" Sri Lankan President Gotabaya Rajapaksa to award a power project to billionaire Gautam Adani’s Adani Group. The official later retracted the claims.

184.title: Pune residents with no pipeline gas connections get bills: Report
184.article_body: Some residents in Pune's Akurdi, Baner and Aundh have recently received pipeline gas bills despite them not having Maharashtra Natural Gas Limited (MNGL) connections, reported Hindustan Times. "We received a bill of ₹2,697. I've sent a complaint to MNGL but there is no response," a resident said. "It doesn't happen frequently...we resolve the issue immediately," MNGL MD Deepak Sawant said.

185.title: I love working with Saif, I find him very funny: Vikram Vedha co-star Radhika
185.article_body: Sharing her experience of working with Saif Ali Khan in 'Vikram Vedha', actress Radhika Apte said that she loves working with him, adding that she finds him very funny. "I'm only laughing on the sets," she added. Radhika has previously worked with Saif in 'Sacred Games' and 'Baazaar'. Radhika further said she had a great time working with Hrithik Roshan.

186.title: Man kills father, runs over 4 cyclists, jumps into river in Germany
186.article_body: A 37-year-old man killed his father and ran over four cyclists while trying to escape the scene in Germany's Mannheim city on Sunday, said police. The suspect then left his damaged vehicle, fled on foot and jumped into the Rhine river, added police. One of the cyclists, a 71-year-old woman, was killed, while the others were taken to hospitals.

187.title: Klaasen targeted spinners well, his execution was very good: Shreyas
187.article_body: Shreyas Iyer, speaking about South Africa batter Heinrich Klaasen's knock in the second T20I, has said, "Klaasen targeted our spinners...well. He played shots off good lengths." Klaasen scored 46-ball 81 runs to help South Africa beat India by four wickets in the second T20I. "I don't think our bowlers did much wrong...It was just...Klaasen's execution was very good," Shreyas stated.

188.title: Delhi districts asked to increase COVID tests; enforce masks: Officials
188.article_body: Amid a rise in the number of COVID-19 cases being reported daily, the Delhi government has asked the district administrations to restart random testing at public places, officials quoted by Hindustan Times, said. The districts have also been asked to increase the number of booster vaccinations and focus on enforcing measures like masking and social distancing, reports said.

189.title: It's not possible: Shakti Kapoor after son Siddhanth gets detained for consuming drugs
189.article_body: After his son Siddhanth Kapoor was detained for consuming drugs at a rave party in a Bengaluru hotel, actor Shakti Kapoor said, "I can only say one thing...it's not possible." Siddhanth was taken to Ulsoor Police Station after he tested positive for drug usage. As per police, five other people at the party also tested positive for drug usage.

190.title: Kuwait to deport expats over protest against Nupur Sharma's Prophet remarks
190.article_body: Kuwait will be deporting expats who took part in a demonstration against the remarks made by suspended BJP spokesperson Nupur Sharma on Prophet Muhammad after Friday prayers. The protesters violated the laws and regulations of the country which stipulate that sit-ins or demonstrations by expats are not to be organised in Kuwait. They will be banned from entering Kuwait again.

191.title: Pune ATM machine catches fire as thieves try to cut it open, ₹3.98 lakh burnt
191.article_body: According to police, ₹3.98 lakh cash was burnt during an attempt to steal money from an ATM in Pimpri Chinchwad on Sunday. Police added that the accused tried to cut open the ATM machine using a gas cutter. However, the machine caught fire and the money inside it was burnt. Two CCTV cameras and some furniture were also damaged.

192.title: RBL Bank shares drop by 18% after appointment of new MD & CEO
192.article_body: Shares of RBL Bank tanked by 18% in Monday's early trade to their 52-week low of ₹92.9 after the appointment of the bank's new MD and CEO. On Saturday, R Subramaniakumar was announced as the bank's MD and CEO for a period of three years, six months after Vishwavir Ahuja stepped down from the position due to the RBI's intervention.

193.title: Car with 5 who went for parathas in Murthal rams truck in Delhi; 2 die
193.article_body: Two persons were killed and three others injured after their car rammed into a stationary truck in Delhi's Swaroop Nagar. The deceased have been identified as Sachin Sapra and Ram Kumar, both aged 26. According to the police, the friends drove to Murthal to have parathas and the accident occurred while they were returning.

194.title: 51-yr-old man sells newborn grandson for ₹60,000 in K’taka’s Davanagere
194.article_body: Four persons were arrested for selling a newborn baby boy for ₹60,000 in Karnataka’s Davanagere, officials said. "A 19-year-old woman…gave birth to a baby boy on June 6," SP, Davanagere, CB Ryshyanth, said. The woman's 51-year-old father sold the baby for ₹60,000, he added. "We got back the baby and handed him to the child welfare commission," the SP stated.

195.title: Sensex falls over 1,400 points to trade at 52,843, Nifty below 15,800
195.article_body: BSE Sensex crashed over 1,400 points to 52,843 and Nifty dipped by 417 points to 15,784 in Monday's early trade. Falling up to 4.02%, Bajaj twins, ICICI Bank and SBI were the top Sensex losers. Notably, the Rupee hit an all-time low after it crossed 78 per US dollar for the first time ever in Monday's early trade.

196.title: Haryana man signals petrol pump staff about being kidnapped in SUV, 2 held
196.article_body: Two people were arrested after a man from Ambala, while being kidnapped in his own SUV along with his friend, signalled petrol pump staff of the situation. The victim, Sanjeev Kumar, said three men had taken lift in SUV. One of the men then pointed a knife at Sanjeev and his friend and demanded ₹50 lakh to let them go.

197.title: Shraddha Kapoor's brother Siddhanth detained for consuming drugs at rave party
197.article_body: Actress Shraddha Kapoor's brother Siddhanth Kapoor was detained during police raid at a rave party in a Bengaluru hotel on Sunday night. As per Bengaluru Police, Siddhanth was among the six people to have tested positive for drug usage. The police raided the hotel after a tip-off and reportedly sent samples of 35 people for drug test.

198.title: DCP posted in Delhi suspended for using forged certificates
198.article_body: A DANIPS officer, posted as Deputy Commissioner of Police in Delhi, has been suspended for allegedly using forged birth and education certificates to be eligible for the UPSC exam. A case of cheating and forgery was filed against him by the CBI in 2020. He is said to have used documents belonging to another person with the same name.

199.title: His knock was phenomenal, one of the best I've seen: Miller on Klaasen's 81(46)
199.article_body: South Africa batter David Miller has praised his teammate Heinrich Klaasen for his 81-run innings against India in the second T20I. "His knock was phenomenal and one of the best I've seen. The conditions in which he played and...to do what he did made it easy for us," stated Miller. South Africa chased down India's 148-run total in 18.2 overs.

200.title: UP CM has become Allahabad HC's Chief Justice: Owaisi on demolition in Prayagraj
200.article_body: After Prayagraj violence accused Javed Ahmed’s property was demolished by UP government, AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi said UP CM Yogi Adityanath is behaving like the "Chief Justice" of Allahabad HC. "He'll convict anyone and demolish their houses?" Owaisi asked. "The house which was demolished is in the name of the wife of accused, who is a Muslim woman," he stated.

201.title: Rupee crosses 78 per US dollar for the 1st time ever, hits record low
201.article_body: Amid a strengthening dollar and rising global oil prices, the Rupee crossed the 78-mark against the US dollar for the first time on Monday. It opened 30 paise lower at 78.14 per US dollar on Monday as against closing at its weakest level of 77.93 in Friday's session. Notably, US inflation climbed to a 40-year high at 8.6% in May.

202.title: Section 144 imposed in Ghaziabad till Aug 10; directions issued for social media use
202.article_body: Section 144 has been imposed in Uttar Pradesh's Ghaziabad district till August 10. The District Magistrate of Ghaziabad said that gatherings without permission will not be allowed during this period. Directions for social media use have also been issued and social media group admins have been asked to inform the administration about rumour-mongers.

203.title: India reports 8,084 COVID-19 cases in 24 hours, active cases rise to 47,995
203.article_body: India has reported 8,084 COVID-19 cases, 4,592 recoveries, and 10 deaths in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after the country saw 8,582 COVID-19 cases and four deaths. Active cases in India increased to 47,995, while the death toll reached 5,24,771.

204.title: Fire incidents in Delhi in May jumped by 54% compared to 2021: DFS
204.article_body: The number of fire incidents reported in Delhi in May this year was 54% more than compared to May 2021. The data shared by the Delhi Fire Service (DFS) reveals that 3,362 fire incidents were reported in May this year while 2,174 were reported last year. DFS chief Atul Garg said usually they receive more fire calls during summer.

205.title: Congress workers protest over Rahul's ED summon in Delhi; detained
205.article_body: The Delhi Police on Monday detained some Congress workers as they held a protest in support of party leader Rahul Gandhi ahead of his appearance before the Enforcement Directorate (ED) in the National Herald case. Videos of the party workers being detained have surfaced online. Earlier, the Delhi Police had denied Congress permission to hold a rally over the same.

206.title: Heavy lifting needed in Air India, expect visible progress in 1-2 yrs: Chandrasekaran
206.article_body: Tata Sons Chairman N Chandrasekaran while speaking about the transformation at Air India said that there "are lots of issues that need heavy lifting". He added, "There is no magic wand... A lot of work needs to be done on IT systems, processes...We want to make Air India the flagship company...In the next 12-24 months, there will be visible progress."

207.title: Delhi Police warns of traffic amid 'special arrangement', share list of areas to avoid
207.article_body: The Delhi Police advised commuters to avoid some routes in view of "special arrangements" on Monday. "Avoid Gol Methi junction, Tughlak Road Junction...Claridges Junction...Q-point Junction, Sunehri Masjid Junction...Maulana Azad Road Junction and Man Singh Road Junction between 7am & 12pm," police said. Police also advised public to avoid Motilal Nehru Marg, Akbar Road, Janpath & Man Singh Road.

208.title: I'm not taking any extra measures to make my skin look different: Masaba
208.article_body: Fashion designer-actress Masaba Gupta has said she's not taking any extra measures to make her skin look different from what it is. "I'm not taking any extra steps to make my body look smaller than what it is," she added. "I'm not trying to fit people's idea of what I should be like if I'm an actor," Masaba further said.

209.title: It was a tricky chase, but we were confident: Bavuma after win vs India
209.article_body: South Africa captain Temba Bavuma said it was a "tricky chase" but they were confident of winning after restricting India to 148/6 in the second T20I on Sunday. "Bhuvneshwar bowled well, he made the ball talk upfront...[but] we knew we had to execute our plans and had to be clinical," he added. SA's Heinrich Klaasen scored 81(46) in the match.

210.title: Delhi records 42°C+ max temp on 25 days this summer, highest in 10 yrs
210.article_body: According to data by India Meteorological Department (IMD), Delhi has recorded maximum temperature of 42 degrees Celsius and above on 25 days so far this summer. This is highest number of such days in ten years since 2012, IMD data said. Reports said in 2012, the city recorded a maximum temperature of 42 degrees Celsius or above on 30 days.

211.title: My fans give me strength to keep going: Kriti on 13 yrs in films
211.article_body: Actress Kriti Kharbanda completed 13 years in the film industry. Taking to Instagram, the actress thanked her fans and wrote, "I work hard for me, but I know you're the reason I don't give up on bad days...you guys...give me the strength to keep going...I love you for that!" Kriti made her acting debut in the 2009 Telugu film 'Boni'.

212.title: Traffic fines halted in Pune after complaints on police conduct
212.article_body: The collection of traffic fines has been put on hold in Pune after several complaints were made against the conduct of traffic police and towing vehicle operators. The traffic policemen have been accused of rude behaviour. Pune Police Commissioner Amitabh Gupta said, "We are trying to streamline the system. Meanwhile, an inquiry is being conducted into the complaints."

213.title: 5 killed, 16 injured in multiple shooting incidents in US' Chicago over weekend
213.article_body: As many as five people were killed and 16 injured after US' Chicago witnessed multiple shooting incidents over the weekend. Among the five people who were killed was 31-year-old rapper FBG Cash. A woman accompanying him also suffered gunshot wounds and was hospitalised. Others killed were in their 20s.

214.title: We were 10-15 runs short, could've bowled better: Pant after defeat vs SA
214.article_body: After Team India's second defeat against South Africa in the five-match T20I series, captain Rishabh Pant said, "I hope we improve in the next game. We need to win all the remaining three games now." On four-wicket defeat in the second T20I, Pant said, "We were 10-15 runs short...[we] bowled well [initially]. But...we weren't up to the mark."

215.title: 73-year-old man dies after car hits his bike in Pune; 1 booked
215.article_body: A 73-year-old man died after a car knocked down his bike in front of a research laboratory on a service road in Pune's Pashan. An assistant inspector said that the 25-year-old female car driver has been booked in the matter and will be produced before a court on Monday. The incident took place on Friday around 4 pm.

216.title: Totally illegal: Ex-CJ of Allahabad HC on demolition of UP violence accused's house
216.article_body: Speaking on the demolition of the house of Prayagraj violence accused Mohammad Javed by UP government, former Allahabad High Court Chief Justice Govind Mathur said, "This is totally illegal." He added, "It's impermissible that you demolish a house on a Sunday when the residents are in custody. It is not a technical issue but a question of rule of law."

217.title: Explosion occurs during washing machine repair in Pune flat
217.article_body: An explosion occurred in a flat in Pune's Bhavani Peth while a washing machine was being repaired. The blast reportedly shattered the glass windows of the flat, but there were no casualties. The Bomb Detection and Disposal Squad (BDDS) and police arrived at the scene after the blast and the resident was taken into custody.

218.title: Sharpshooter allegedly involved in Sidhu Moosewala's killing arrested from Gujarat
218.article_body: Pune Police have arrested Santosh Jadhav, a sharpshooter allegedly involved in the killing of singer-politician Sidhu Moosewala, from Gujarat. The police also apprehended Jadhav's aide, who is also a suspect in the murder case. Moosewala was shot dead by assailants in Jawaharke village of Punjab's Mansa district on May 29.

219.title: Bidding for IPL TV and digital rights cross ₹43,000-crore mark on Day 1
219.article_body: On Day 1 of the IPL media rights e-auction, the TV rights bid reached ₹57 crore per game and the digital rights bid stood at ₹48 crore per game. While a total of 410 matches are planned from the 2023-2027 IPL cycle, the media rights value per game stood at ₹105 crore and ₹43,050 crore for the five-year period.

220.title: As stolen 2-wheeler runs out of fuel, man robs 14-yr-old of scooter in Punjab
220.article_body: A man allegedly robbed a 14-year-old girl of scooter in Punjab's Mohali after his scooter, that was found to be stolen from Amritsar, ran out of fuel. Police said the girl, while returning from grocery store, stopped to see if the man needed any help. The man tried to snatch her phone and drove away with her scooter, police added.

221.title: Delhi govt to turn Asola Bhatti sanctuary's mining pits into reservoirs
221.article_body: Delhi government has planned to transform 14 mining pits inside the Asola Bhatti wildlife sanctuary into reservoirs to solve the waterlogging crisis faced by surrounding areas. A committee will be set up to prepare the project's master plan in next 30 days, officials said. The government is also planning to turn the area overlooking Neeli Jheel into an eco-tourism spot.

222.title: My ex-husband Ritesh has hacked my social media, he's taking revenge: Rakhi
222.article_body: Actress Rakhi Sawant has filed a complaint after her social media accounts were allegedly hacked by her ex-partner, Ritesh. In a few viral videos, Rakhi was seen crying inconsolably as she reached the Oshiwara police station. The actress was accompanied by her boyfriend Adil Khan. She said, "He's in revenge mode...He wants to...ruin my relationship with Salman Khan Bhai."

223.title: The universe has given me second chance: Sonali on starring in The Broken News
223.article_body: Sonali Bendre took to Instagram to share a post about making a comeback with 'The Broken News'. Sharing a video, Sonali wrote, "I see this as a beginning because I think the universe has given me a second chance and I need to make good on it!" "I'm no longer an accidental actor. I’m choosing to do this," she added.

224.title: Hima beats Dutee to win 100m at 61st National Interstate Athletics C'ships
224.article_body: Indian sprinter Hima Das won a gold medal in women's 100 metres at 61st National Interstate Athletics Championships in Chennai on Saturday. She won with a timing of 11.43 seconds. Olympian Dutee Chand came second, clocking 11.44 seconds. Following her win 22-year-old Hima said, "Happy to make a comeback after an injury and hard work of nearly two years."

225.title: Rare albino Galapagos giant tortoise born in Swiss zoo, pics released
225.article_body: A rare albino Galapagos giant tortoise was recently born at a Swiss zoo and made its public debut this month. It's part of a pair of newborn tortoises at the zoo. While one of them is black in colour like its parents, the other one is albino. The two babies' genders haven't been determined yet.

226.title: Heinrich Klaasen records highest T20I score by a South Africa batter against India
226.article_body: South Africa wicketkeeper-batter Heinrich Klaasen on Sunday recorded the highest score in a T20I against India by a South Africa batter. The 30-year-old scored 81 runs off 46 deliveries in the Cuttack T20I to set the record. Quinton De Kock had held the previous record, scoring 79*(52) in Bengaluru on September 22, 2019.

227.title: Silence of liberals on death threats against Nupur deafening: Gambhir
227.article_body: BJP MP Gautam Gambhir on Sunday condemned the threats issued against suspended BJP spokesperson Nupur Sharma for her remarks against  Prophet Muhammad. "Silence of so called 'secular liberals' on the sickening display of hatred and death threats throughout the country against a woman who has apologised is surely deafening," he said. Gambhir added that he didn't support her statements.

228.title: Let's protect their childhood: Harbhajan on World Day Against Child Labour
228.article_body:
On the occasion of World Day Against Child Labour on Sunday, Harbhajan Singh took to Twitter and wrote, "On this World Day Against Child Labour, let us all come together and protect the innocence and childhood of our children." He added, "They [children] deserve to enjoy their early years and we
 all can make it happen with a combined effort."

229.title: Chiranjeevi comes on board for Ranbir & Alia starrer Brahmastra: Reports
229.article_body: Actor Chiranjeevi has reportedly come on board for actors Ranbir Kapoor and Alia Bhatt starrer- 'Brahmastra'. According to reports, the makers will soon make an official announcement about his association. Reports added that the film's director Ayan Mukerji recently flew to Hyderabad to have a meeting with the actor and finalise the details.

230.title: Plenty of new opportunities for Indian business in Russia: Envoy
230.article_body: There are plenty of new opportunities for Indian business in Russian market, especially after many western countries' withdrawal, said Russian Ambassador Denis Alipov. The multidimensional cooperation between India and Russia is among the world's "most elaborate ones", he said. Priority is being given to early conclusion of free trade pact between the Eurasian Economic Union and India, he added.

231.title: Rajnath, Nadda to hold talks with other parties for Presidential poll
231.article_body: The BJP has said that Union Minister Rajnath Singh and BJP chief JP Nadda will hold consultations on behalf of the party with political parties on the upcoming Presidential election. BJP said they will begin holding these consultations soon. The Presidential election is scheduled to be held on July 18 and the votes will be counted on July 21.

232.title: Afghanistan take unassailable 2-0 lead after 2nd T20I win vs Zimbabwe
232.article_body: Afghanistan beat Zimbabwe by 21 runs in the second T20I in Harare to take an unassailable 2-0 lead in the three-match series. Afghanistan posted 170/5 in 20 overs, with batter Najibullah Zadran top scoring (57) for the side. Zimbabwe managed to score 149/7 in 20 overs. Third and final T20I will be played on Tuesday.

233.title: North Korea fires suspected artillery shots into sea: South Korea
233.article_body: North Korea fired multiple suspected artillery shots in the sea on Sunday, the South Korean military said. South Korea maintains a firm military readiness in close coordination with the US amid boosted surveillance on North Korea, it added. Notably, the show of force comes a day after North Korean leader Kim Jong-un vowed to boost the country's military power.

234.title: Video of woman being beaten by several men at restaurant sparks outrage in China
234.article_body: A video showing some women being assaulted by a group of around nine men at a restaurant has been widely shared on Chinese social media, sparking outrage. The attack began after one of the men touched a woman's back and she pushed him away. She was dragged outside and thrashed. Women who tried to help her were also beaten.

235.title: India's first display manufacturing facility to be set up in T'gana
235.article_body: Elest has signed an agreement with Telangana government to set up India's first display manufacturing facility worth ₹24,000 crore. The facility will manufacture displays for smartphones, tablet computers, laptops, etc. The government is confident that the facility will be a major boost for state's electronics and IT ecosystem and its ancillaries, said Telangana Industries Minister KT Rama Rao.

236.title: India lose their 2nd T20I match in a row as South Africa take 2-0 series lead
236.article_body: South Africa defeated India by four wickets in the second T20I in Cuttack to take a 2-0 lead in the five-match series. India have now lost two T20I matches in a row after having won 12 straight T20I matches. South Africa restricted India to 148/6 in their 20 overs, before chasing down the target in 18.2 overs.

237.title: IAS officer shares Patna University notice full of grammatical errors, calls it 'appalling'
237.article_body: Sanjay Kumar, a 1990 batch IAS officer and the Secretary of Youth Affairs in the Ministry of Youth Affairs and Sports, shared a Patna University circular and said, "The grammar and syntax used is appalling for a professor." "All Research Scholars must be mark signature in attendance register otherwise absent mark in attendance register," the notice read.

238.title: Harry Styles fan falls from balcony during his concert in Scotland; survives
238.article_body: During singer Harry Styles' concert in Glasgow, a man reportedly fell from the top tier of a stand at Ibrox Stadium on Saturday. Several people, who witnessed the man falling, tweeted about it on Twitter and said it was "traumatising". Reports added that the man landed on other people in the lower tier but managed to avoid serious injuries.

239.title: 11 injured in bee attack at Pune fort, 4th incident since March
239.article_body: Around 11 tourists were injured in a bee attack at Pune's Sinhagad Fort on Sunday afternoon, officials said. Local officials said that some of the injured in the attack are children. This is the fourth time swarms of bees have attacked visitors at the state's tourist sites since March. Of the 11, two were given treatment on the spot.

240.title: Turkey's concerns on Finland, Sweden's NATO bid valid: NATO chief
240.article_body: NATO chief Jens Stoltenberg said on Sunday that Turkey's security concerns over Finland and Sweden's membership in the bloc are valid. "These are legitimate concerns. This is about terrorism, it's about weapons exports," Stoltenberg said during a visit to Finland. Turkey has raised concerns over the Nordic countries' membership bid, stating that they have ties with a Kurdish militant group.

241.title: No pardon for UK citizens who fought for Ukraine: Separatist leader
241.article_body: The leader of Ukrainian breakaway region of Donetsk People's Republic said on Sunday that there's no reason to pardon two British nationals who were sentenced to death recently for fighting on behalf of Ukraine. Aslin and Pinner, along with Moroccan national Brahim Saadoun, were convicted of mercenary activities and terrorism. UK has criticised the judgement and called it a "sham".

242.title: Tiger kills 50-year-old man in Maharashtra's Chandrapur district
242.article_body: A 50-year-old man was killed by a tiger in Maharashtra's Chandrapur district on Sunday, an official said. He had gone to the forest along with his wife and mother to collect wood to build a fence around his residence, the official added. "After his mother and wife raised an alarm, the feline disappeared from the spot," the official further said.

243.title: Films like Heropanti & Baaghi have lost its audience: Director Sabbir Khan
243.article_body: Filmmaker Sabbir Khan said that the films 'Heropanti' and 'Baaghi' were not made with the intent to turn them into a franchise. "They were organic films. For me, a sequel is something where you take the story and characters forward," he added. Sabbir further said that he hasn't seen sequels of 'Heropanti' and 'Baaghi' as they've lost their audience.

244.title: We request the US to stop smearing us: China
244.article_body: Speaking at the Shangri-La Dialogue, Chinese Defence Minister Wei Fenghe said, "We request the US side to stop smearing and containing China. Stop interfering in China's internal affairs." He added that the bilateral relationship cannot improve unless the US side can do that. This comes after US President Joe Biden said US would respond "militarily" if China attacked Taiwan.

245.title: India lose 0-5 to Belgium in their 2nd leg tie at Women's Pro Hockey League
245.article_body: Indian women's hockey team lost to Belgium 0-5 in the second leg of their FIH Hockey Pro League tie in Antwerp, Belgium, on Sunday. They lost the first match against Belgium 1-2 on Saturday. India will next face Argentina on June 18 and 19 in Rotterdam, Netherlands. With 22 points from 10 matches, India are currently third in the standings.

246.title: Iran's currency hits record low against US dollar amid sanctions
246.article_body: Iran's currency on Sunday dropped to its lowest value ever against the US dollar amid American sanctions over the Iranian nuclear programme. Traders in Iran's capital Tehran exchanged the rial at 3,32,000 to the US dollar. Notably, the Iranian currency was trading at 32,000 rials to the dollar at the time of Iran's 2015 nuclear deal with world powers.

247.title: Sikh man selling fuel at $500 loss a day in US, says 'not here to make money'
247.article_body: A Sikh gas station owner in US is selling fuel to his customers at a lower price than his purchase cost amid rising costs. Jaswiendre Singh said he's suffering a loss of about $500 per day by selling nearly 3,785 litres of gas. He said, "We're not here to make money right now. I'm very happy to help other people."

248.title: Sri Lanka plans to introduce weekly fuel rationing from next month
248.article_body: Sri Lanka plans to introduce a weekly fuel rationing scheme from next month, Sri Lankan Energy Minister Kanchana Wijesekera said on Sunday. The restriction will remain in place until steady supply of fuel is resumed in the country, he added. Notably, the move comes amid an economic crisis that has led to a shortage of fuel in Sri Lanka.

249.title: Joe Root smashes his 27th Test hundred, equals Kohli, Smith's tally
249.article_body: Former England captain Joe Root smashed his 27th hundred in Test cricket by reaching the three-figure mark off 116 deliveries in the first innings of the second Test against New Zealand. With this, Root equalled the tally of Virat Kohli and Steve Smith. Root also became the 12th highest run-scorer in Test cricket, surpassing Sunil Gavaskar's tally of 10,122 runs.

250.title: Illegal guns found in home of Prayagraj violence accused before it was razed: Police
250.article_body: Uttar Pradesh Police found .12 bore and .315 bore illegal pistols and cartridges from the home of Prayagraj violence main accused Javed Mohammed before demolishing it on Sunday, Senior Superintendent of Police Ajay Kumar said. Javed was arrested on Saturday for his role in the protests over remarks against Prophet Muhammad. Police said inappropriate material was recovered from his home.

251.title: I'd commit to doing it for 17 more in a heartbeat: Chhetri on 17th anniversary of debut
251.article_body: Indian football team captain Sunil Chhetri penned a note on Instagram on the occasion of the 17th anniversary of his India debut. He wrote, "It's been an honour that I cannot explain in words, to have worn the national team shirt for 17 years." He added, "I'd commit to doing it for 17 more in a heartbeat."

252.title: Ukraine's grain exports via Poland, Romania has bottlenecks: Minister
252.article_body: Ukrainian Deputy Foreign Minister Dmytro Senik said on Sunday that country has established two routes via Poland and Romania to export grains, but they have bottlenecks that have slowed supply chain. Senik added that global food security was at risk due to Russian invasion. Ukraine is unable to export grains due to a Russian blockade at its Black Sea ports.

253.title: Kanpur violence well-planned conspiracy: VHP General Secretary
253.article_body: Vishva Hindu Parishad's General Secretary Milind Parande on Sunday expressed concern over the Kanpur violence last Friday and described it as a "well-planned conspiracy". Violence had erupted on June 3 in Kanpur following Friday prayers over suspended BJP leader Nupur Sharma's alleged derogatory remarks on Prophet Muhammad in a television debate.

254.title: CID actors Dayanand, Shraddha Musale, Aditya Srivastava have reunion, share pics
254.article_body: The cast of the show 'CID' including Shraddha Musale, Dayanand Shetty, Aditya Shrivastava, Ajay Nagrath and Dinesh Phadnis reunited but for a get-together. Sharing pictures from the evening, Shraddha wrote, “Such evening...Nostalgic stories...leg-pulling, conversations. Great to have you all home. Being a weekday, travelling at...peak hours with so much traffic and still on time."

255.title: Kartik Aaryan supported 'Shehzada' financially: Producer Bhushan Kumar
255.article_body: Film producer Bhushan Kumar spoke about celebrities hiking their fees and its impact on films. Bhushan revealed that actor Kartik Aaryan has always been supportive in this case. "He has always been like that. For our next film, Shehzada, we were having some problems. But Kartik stood by us," Bhushan said. "He supported us financially as well," Bhushan added.

256.title: Red Bull's Verstappen wins Azerbaijan F1 GP after Leclerc's engine failure
256.article_body: Red Bull's Max Verstappen won Azerbaijan Formula One Grand Prix on Sunday and extended his championship lead after an engine failure on Charles Leclerc's Ferrari, while Verstappen's teammate Sergio Perez finished second. Leclerc was leading when he retired with a smoking engine on the 20th lap after Ferrari teammate Carlos Sainz suffered the same fate. Mercedes' George Russell finished third.

257.title: Mumbai reports 1,803 new COVID-19 cases, 2 deaths; positivity rate at 11.32%
257.article_body: Mumbai reported 1,803 fresh cases of COVID-19 on Sunday, a day after recording 1,745 fresh cases. The city also saw two deaths due to COVID-19 in the last 24 hours, while the positivity rate stood at 11.32%. The number of active cases has risen to 10,889 from 10,047 reported on Saturday, as per a health bulletin.

258.title: Delhi reports 735 COVID-19 cases in last 24 hrs, 3 deaths
258.article_body: Delhi on Sunday reported 735 fresh COVID-19 cases, taking the overall infection tally in the city to 19,12,798. Three people succumbed to the virus, taking the overall death toll to 26,221. This is the third consecutive day that Delhi has recorded over 600 cases. There are currently 2,442 active cases in the city.

259.title: Under what law?: Tharoor after razing of violence accused's property in UP
259.article_body: After Prayagraj violence accused Javed Mohammad's property was demolished by Uttar Pradesh government, Congress' Shashi Tharoor asked under what law and following what process was the property razed. "Has UP exempted itself from the Constitution of India?" Tharoor tweeted. "Cops carrying out custodial torture receive laurels but being a vocal Muslim is a crime," AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi said.

260.title: Haryana CM residence to be known as Sant Kabir Kutir: Khattar
260.article_body: Haryana CM Manohar Lal Khattar on Sunday announced that his official residence in Chandigarh will be known as Sant Kabir Kutir. Khattar also said the provision of "cadre-wise reservation" during promotions will be introduced for state government employees. He added that free railway tickets will be provided to those travelling to Banaras, the birthplace of Sant Kabir.

261.title: 25-yr-old Pakistani soldier killed in shootout with militants
261.article_body: A 25-year-old Pakistani soldier was killed during a gunfight with militants in the North Waziristan district that borders Afghanistan, Pakistan's military said in a statement on Sunday. The security forces quickly started a search-and-clearance operation to locate militants who fled, it added. However, no militant group immediately claimed responsibility for the attack.

262.title: 16-yr-old dies by suicide after friends mock him over defeat in PUBG
262.article_body: A 16-year-old allegedly died by suicide in Andhra Pradesh after his friends mocked him after he lost in the online game PUBG. The boy, who was the son of a local Congress official, was hooked on the online game. District Congress president Thantiya Kumari requested the central government to prohibit PUBG-style games since they are taking lives, reports said.

263.title: Over 14,000 acres area damaged due to wildfires in Pak: Report
263.article_body: An area of over 14,000 acres was reportedly damaged in Pakistan's Khyber Pakhtunkhwa after more than 200 wildfires continued to rage in the province over the last two weeks. The area includes forests and pastures, a media report stated. Around 55 blazes were started intentionally by people, while causes of another 143 blazes are unknown, according to a government report.

264.title: Putin's rumoured girlfriend seen in public for the 1st time since western sanctions
264.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin's rumoured girlfriend Alina Kabaeva was recently seen in Sochi, making it the first time she was seen in public since she was sanctioned by several western nations.  A video has shown the 39-year-old Olympic gold-winning gymnast interacting with children. She was sanctioned by the UK in May, followed by Canada and the EU.

265.title: Messi, Ronaldo are on a different level to anyone else out there: Gerrard
265.article_body: Aston Villa manager Steven Gerrard has said Lionel Messi and Cristiano Ronaldo are on a different level to everyone else in the game. "But Ronaldo doesn't get in my team...Ronaldo will win you things but I am more about a team player than an individual player, so I'll always go down that road," he added.

266.title: Train vandalised in Bengal amid fresh incidents of violence over Prophet remarks
266.article_body: People protesting against BJP leaders' remarks against Prophet Muhammad damaged a local train in Bethuadahari railway station in West Bengal's Nadia district on Sunday, police said. An officer said that services on the Lalgola line have been affected due to the attack. Violence was also reported in North 24 Parganas and Murshidabad districts.

267.title: Russia destroyed warehouses with 3 lakh tonnes of grains: Ukraine
267.article_body: Russian shelling last weekend may have destroyed up to 3 lakh tonnes of grains stored in Ukrainian warehouses, Ukraine's Deputy Agriculture Minister Taras Vysotskyi claimed on Saturday. The warehouses, which mostly held wheat and corn, are located in the Black Sea port of Mykolaiv, Vysotskyi said. The Russian forces have blockaded Ukrainian ports amid the war.

268.title: SAD's Parkash Singh Badal admitted to hospital in Mohali, is stable
268.article_body: Shiromani Akali Dal (SAD) patriarch Parkash Singh Badal has been admitted to a private hospital in Mohali, a party spokesperson confirmed on Sunday. The 94-year-old was admitted on Saturday after he vomited but his condition is stated to be stable now. Badal was admitted to another hospital on June 6 due to gastric-related problems but was discharged the following day.

269.title: 8 policemen suspended after lapse in security of UP CM Yogi
269.article_body: Eight policemen were suspended after a lapse in security of Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath while he was on his way to welcome BJP chief JP Nadda at Gorakhpur Airport on Friday. Those who have been suspended include an Inspector and a Sub-Inspector. When Adityanath was going to receive Nadda, many vehicles had come in front of his fleet.

270.title: Businessman Jindal's pics used in reports on ex-BJP leader, JSPL issues statement
270.article_body: Businessman Naveen Jindal was misidentified as expelled BJP leader Naveen Jindal in some media reports, Jindal Steel and Power Limited (JSPL) said. "We urge all to avoid the mistake....refrain from using photographs or social media handles of our Chairman with regards to the concerned matter," said JSPL. The businessman is "in no way related" to the issue, it clarified.

271.title: List of cities with highest maximum temperature on Sunday released
271.article_body: The India Meteorological Department has released the list of cities that recorded maximum temperature of 44°C or more. Delhi's Ridge recorded the highest maximum temperature of 45.8°C, followed by Haryana's Hisar at 45°C. Other cities include Rajasthan's Ganganagar (44.8°C), Uttar Pradesh's Varanasi (44.6°C), Jharkhand's Daltonganj (44.6°C) and Rajasthan's Churu (44.5°C).

272.title: No power on Earth can force India on any issue: Piyush Goyal
272.article_body: After attending the G-33 Ministerial Meeting in Geneva, Union Minister for Commerce and Industry Piyush Goyal said, "No power on Earth can force India and the Modi government on any issue whatsoever." "No one can pressurise today's 'Aatmanirbhar Bharat'. We can face any challenge. We don't take any decision under pressure," he stated.

273.title: Rishi ji & I broke up during the shoot of song Parda Hai Parda: Neetu
273.article_body: Actress Neetu Kapoor recalled shooting for song 'Parda Hai Parda' with her late husband, actor Rishi Kapoor. "Rishi ji and I were at loggerheads...We used to fight...with each other and had broken up at that time," she said. "It was a romantic song where I had to throw...rose but what was going in my mind was something else," she added.

274.title: It became difficult to enjoy tennis: Andreescu on her mental health break
274.article_body: Talking about why she took a mental health break, 2019 US Open champion Bianca Andreescu said she had gone through so much chaos that it became difficult to listen to herself and enjoy tennis. "Being away from the sport made me realise that I truly loved it," she added. Andreescu played her first match in seven months in April 2022.

275.title: 75 ministers to perform yoga across 75 locations on Int'l Yoga Day
275.article_body: As many as 75 ministers from the Central government will perform yoga across 75 locations in India to mark International Yoga Day on June 21. PM Narendra Modi will perform yoga at Mysore Palace, while Home Minister Amit Shah will participate in yoga programs at Nashik's Trimbakeshwar temple complex. Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman will perform yoga at Delhi's Jantar Mantar.

276.title: Lineman cuts power supply of police station after SI fines him
276.article_body: After a lineman was fined by a Sub-Inspector for not wearing a helmet, he cut the power supply of the police station where the official was deployed in Uttar Pradesh's Bareilly. The lineman alleged that the power connection was illegal. He said he will lodge a power theft complaint against the police official.

277.title: Centre misusing agencies to suppress Opp'n voices: Chhattisgarh CM
277.article_body: Responding to the summons issued by the ED to Congress leader Rahul Gandhi, Chhattisgarh CM Bhupesh Baghel on Sunday said that the Centre is misusing agencies like CBI, IT to suppress the Opposition's voice. "I will be going to Delhi today as Rahul Gandhi has to appear in front of the ED tomorrow," he said.

278.title: Apple to allow different payment options in dating apps: Dutch watchdog
278.article_body: Netherlands' Authority for Consumers and Markets (ACM) said Apple will allow different payment methods in Dutch dating applications, thereby meeting the requirements set by the watchdog. ACM's Chairman of the board Martijn Snoep said Apple avoided its responsibility of keeping the digital economy's market "fair and open". This dispute also led to Apple being fined €50 million by the ACM.

279.title: 2 Army soldiers missing for 2 weeks, presumed to have fallen into a river
279.article_body: Naik Prakash Singh and Lance Naik Harender Singh, deployed in the forward areas of Anjaw district in Arunachal Pradesh, have been missing for two weeks. They are "presumed to have accidentally fallen into a fast-flowing river in close proximity to their post", the PRO, Tezpur said. The search operations have been ongoing for the last two weeks, it added.

280.title: 'Modi pressured Rajapaksa to give project to Adani,' says SL official; revokes claim
280.article_body: A top Sri Lankan official has claimed that PM Narendra Modi "pressured" Sri Lankan President Gotabaya Rajapaksa to award a power project to billionaire Gautam Adani's Adani Group. The official later retracted the claims made in front of a parliamentary panel, saying he was "emotional". Rajapaksa's office also issued a statement "vehemently denying" influencing anybody in awarding the project.

281.title: Ukrainian troops defying expectations in war, says Zelenskyy
281.article_body: Ukraine's President Volodymyr Zelenskyy on Sunday said that the Ukrainian forces are defying expectations by preventing Russian troops from overrunning eastern Ukraine. Zelenskyy also said that he is proud of the Ukrainian defenders managing to hold back the Russian advance in the Donbas region. Russia had launched a fresh offensive in eastern Ukraine in April.

282.title: She had best of everything, yet succumbed to depression: Upasana on designer Prathyusha
282.article_body: Entrepreneur Upasana Kamineni, who's married to actor Ram Charan, mourned the death of celebrity fashion designer Prathyusha Garimella saying, "My bestie my dearest friend. Gone too soon." Upasana added, "She had the best of everything, career, friends and family- yet succumbed to depression...I believe karmic baggage passes through lifetimes." Garimella was found dead at her home on Saturday.

283.title: Villagers in Bihar hold BJP MLA hostage over development work delay
283.article_body: BJP MLA Kumar Shailendra was held hostage inside a school in Bihar's Lokmanpur village on Sunday. Shailendra, who was visiting the village to spread awareness about Centre's projects, was held captive for two hours as villagers were upset over delayed development works. "[Villagers] said that until....flood management [work] doesn't begin, they won't let me leave," Shailendra wrote on Facebook.

284.title: We got one-dimensional, too predictable: McDonald on Aus' 3rd T20I loss
284.article_body: Following Australia's four-wicket loss in third T20I against Sri Lanka, Australia head coach Andrew McDonald said the side was a little "one-dimensional" and "too predictable" at certain periods. "And probably went away from what made us really good in...first two games, albeit we weren't defending a total," he added. Australia won the series 2-1, having won the first two matches.

285.title: Tens of thousands demand stricter gun control measures in US
285.article_body: Tens of thousands of people called for stricter gun control measures in protests across the US on Saturday. The protests come after a string of deadly mass shootings in the country recently. Notably, more than 19,300 people have died in gun-related incidents in the country so far this year, according to the Gun Violence Archive.

286.title: Umran is most exciting prospect I've seen in last 10 years: Vengsarkar
286.article_body: Dilip Vengsarkar has said pacer Umran Malik deserves to play for India following his recent performance in IPL 2022. "He's one of the most exciting prospects I've seen in the last 10 years. I hope he does well because he looks very fit...has that aggression of a fast bowler," he added. Umran took 22 wickets in 14 matches in IPL.

287.title: Delhi man fakes own abduction as parents oppose his relationship
287.article_body: A 24-year-old man, identified as Gaurav Mishra, faked his own kidnapping in Delhi after his parents opposed his relationship. Police used CCTV footage, mobile tracking to track Gaurav down, who later confessed to his crime. "As Gaurav Mishra had given false information to parents and police and misused government machinery, appropriate legal action is being taken against him," police said.

288.title: Minor domestic help jumps to death after she's caught stealing in Mumbai
288.article_body: A 16-year-old girl working as a house help in Mumbai's Nagpada died by suicide after jumping from her employer's house on the 16th floor of Orchid Tower. Police said the girl jumped after she was caught stealing by her employers. Police have registered an accidental death report and booked the minor's employers under the Child Labour Act.

289.title: South Africa to bowl first against India in 2nd T20I, playing XIs announced
289.article_body: South Africa captain Temba Bavuma won the toss and elected to bowl first against India in the second T20I. South Africa have made two changes to their playing XI, with injured Quinton de Kock and Tristan Stubbs being replaced by Heinrich Klaasen and Reeza Hendricks. India are playing with the same XI.

290.title: Never asked dad about his 4 marriages, it was his life: Amit on Kishore Kumar
290.article_body: Late singer Kishore Kumar's son Amit Kumar said he never asked his father about his four marriages. "It was his personal life. He always wanted a family," Amit added. "He was a family man. It was just that he was misunderstood," Amit said. Amit also revealed his step-mom Leena writes songs for him. "She is a brilliant writer," he added.

291.title: Changes needed in process to issue Aadhaar card: Bengaluru Police
291.article_body: After busting a gang that allegedly used fake stamps to create gazetted officer's letter in Bengaluru, police said they'll ask Unique Identification Authority of India to make changes to address verification process for issuing Aadhaar cards. The gang allegedly helped illegal migrants, especially from Bangladesh, to get Aadhaar cards and other citizenship-related documents by using fake stamps.

292.title: Even Fadnavis will vote for us if ED control given to Shiv Sena: Raut
292.article_body: Shiv Sena leader Sanjay Raut on Sunday said that if the control of the ED is given to his party, then even BJP's Devendra Fadnavis will vote for Sena. Raut's comments came following the recently concluded RS elections in Maharashtra. He had previously alleged that BJP was using central agencies to put pressure on smaller parties to vote for them.

293.title: Wife of ex-Chambal dacoit elected as sarpanch unopposed in MP
293.article_body: Former Chambal dacoit Malkhan Singh's wife, Lalita Rajput, has been elected as sarpanch by people of Sungayayi village in Madhya Pradesh's Guna district. Lalita was elected unopposed even as panchayat elections in state are supposed to commence on June 25. "There's no light or road or sewerage so I want to work for the development of my village," Lalita said.

294.title: Wild elephant kills 47-year-old man in Chhattisgarh
294.article_body: A wild elephant on Saturday evening killed a 47-year-old man in Chhattisgarh's Gaurela-Pendra-Marwahi district, a forest official said on Sunday. The elephant lifted Ramdhan Gond with its trunk, flung him to the ground and trampled him, the official added. Notably, four people have been killed in elephant attacks in the district since March this year.

295.title: Inspiration for others: MP CM meets woman who fought her attackers
295.article_body: Madhya Pradesh CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan on Sunday met the woman, who was attacked with a blade for resisting eve-teasing by three men in Bhopal and called her an "inspiration for others". CM gave compensation of ₹1 lakh and said that the state government will bear her medical expenses. "Plastic surgeons and doctors will take care of her," he added.

296.title: It might be for last time to see Kane lead NZ Test side in 3rd Test: Doull
296.article_body: Ex-New Zealand pacer Simon Doull said if Kane Williamson, who tested COVID-19 positive ahead of second England-New Zealand Test, is fit to play and captain the side in third Test, it might be for the last time in Test cricket. "It's time for Tom Latham to take over this Test...side," he added. In Williamson's absence, Latham was appointed as captain.

297.title: Iran & Venezuela sign 20-year cooperation plan amid US sanctions
297.article_body: Iran and Venezuela signed a 20-year cooperation plan during Venezuelan President Nicolas Maduro's visit to Tehran on Saturday. The countries, both of which are under US sanctions, will cooperate in the fields of oil, petrochemicals, defence, agriculture, tourism and culture. "Venezuela has shown exemplary resistance against...threats from...imperialists," Iranian President Ebrahim Raisi said.

298.title: Govt loses appeal against order in Reliance, Shell dispute: Report
298.article_body: The Centre has lost its appeal in the English HC against a $111 million arbitration award in Reliance and Shell's favour in a cost recovery dispute, PTI reported. The case pertains to a production sharing contract signed between Reliance, Shell and the Centre for oil, natural gas production. Government should've objected when Arbitration Tribunal passed initial orders, the HC said.

299.title: Bodies of 2 missing friends fished out of stone quarry in Pune
299.article_body: The bodies of two men, aged 20 and 21, were fished out of a stone quarry in Pune's Dhanori area. The men, who were residents of Vishrantwadi, were friends and had gone missing on June 8. Some locals saw the bodies floating in the stone quarry, following which a team of Pune Fire Brigade reached the spot.

300.title: UK town 'swallowed up' by sea discovered after over 650 years, say scientists
300.article_body: Scientists believe they have found the 'lost' British town of Ravenser Odd over 650 years after it was "swallowed up" by the North Sea in 1362. The sunken town, called 'Yorkshire's Atlantis', was earlier believed to be at the bottom of the sea. But a new search using sonar equipment has revealed rocks and stoneworks closer to the water's surface.

301.title: Dutch MP shares screenshots of death threats he received for supporting Nupur Sharma
301.article_body: After tweeting in favour of suspended BJP leader Nupur Sharma amid controversy over her remarks against Prophet Muhammad, Dutch MP Geert Wilders said that he received hundreds of death threats. Sharing screenshots of some of the death threats, Wilders wrote, "It makes me even more determined and proud supporting her. For evil may never win. Never."

302.title: You gave me the confidence to carry the bald look: Mahima to Anupam
302.article_body: Actress Mahima Chaudhry took to Instagram to share that actor Anupam Kher motivated her to carry the bald look. "I've had...many people who met me recently say they never noticed I was wearing a wig," she added. "I've had...friends with alopecia and scanty hair ask me where they can get good wigs. [If] you want one, wear one," Mahima said.

303.title: 21-yr-old kidnaps minor girl from Goa labour camp; held in Gurugram
303.article_body: A 21-year-old man was arrested in Gurugram on Sunday for allegedly kidnapping a minor girl from a highway project labour camp in Goa, a police official said. The accused, identified as Anil Rawat, stayed with the victim in the same camp, said DSP (Pernem) Siddhant Shirodkar. "The father of the victim had filed a complaint last week," he added.

304.title: Houses of 2 accused who attacked woman with blade demolished in MP
304.article_body: The houses of two men who allegedly attacked a woman with a blade for resisting eve-teasing in Madhya Pradesh's Bhopal were demolished on Sunday. The accused were arrested by the police on Saturday. The 32-year-old woman had received 118 stitches on her face. Her one eye is not opening and she's not able to speak, police said.

305.title: China's nuclear arsenal only for self-defence, says Defence Minister
305.article_body: Chinese Defence Minister Wei Fenghe on Sunday claimed that China will only use its nuclear weapons for self-defence and never use them first. "China has developed its capabilities for over five decades. It's fair to say there has been impressive progress," he said. He also said that the ultimate goal of China's nuclear arsenal was to prevent nuclear war.

306.title: Dutch startup unveils ₹2 crore solar car that can run for months without charging
306.article_body: Dutch startup Lightyear has unveiled its first solar-powered electric car, which it claims can be driven for up to seven months without charging. Dubbed 'Lightyear 0', the car features 53.8 sq ft of curved solar panels across its hood and roof and is priced at €250,000 (over ₹2 crore). The startup claims it is the world's first production-ready solar car.

307.title: Chances of major waterlogging in Navi Mumbai are minimal: NMMC Commissioner
307.article_body: The Municipal Commissioner of the Navi Mumbai Municipal Corporation Abhijit Bangar has said that the chances of major waterlogging in Navi Mumbai are "minimal". "Unless there is an excessive rainfall accompanied with high tide, the chances of...major waterlogging [are] minimal as, during the past two months, most of the pre-monsoon nullah cleaning work has been completed," Bangar said.

308.title: ED's summons to Rahul Gandhi 'baseless': Cong leader Chidambaram
308.article_body: Congress leader P Chidambaram on Sunday stated that the summons issued by the ED to former party chief Rahul Gandhi is "baseless". He said that a money laundering case involves money and laundering of money, which didn't happen. "It is like accusing a person of the offence of 'purse snatching' when there was no purse and no snatching," he added.

309.title: Hardik is the most valuable T20 cricketer in world cricket right now: Hogg
309.article_body: Former Australia cricketer Brad Hogg has said Team India all-rounder Hardik Pandya is the "most valuable T20 cricketer in the world right now". "Hardik should be captain of [India's] T20 team in front of Rahul...He proved his worth in the IPL," added Hogg. Hardik scored unbeaten 31 off 12 balls in the first T20I against South Africa.

310.title: BJP clarified respecting all religions is its priority: UP minister on Prophet remarks
310.article_body: Amid the ongoing violence over remarks on Prophet Muhammad, UP minister Danish Azad Ansari said the party’s action clarified that respecting all religions is its priority. "Our party and our government believe in unity and respect of all religions. They are going to work together with all parties," he added. "We should talk about peace," Ansari stated.

311.title: 25-year-old law student who hit biker & ran away in Delhi gets bail
311.article_body: The driver of a Mahindra Scorpio who hit a biker and ran away following a verbal altercation near South Delhi's Arjan Garh has been granted bail by a Delhi court. Anuj Chaudhary, a 25-year-old law student, was arrested a day after the incident's video went viral on social media. Chaudhary was granted bail as the biker hadn't sustained serious injuries.

312.title: IIT-B study recommends measures to prevent railway line flooding in Mumbai
312.article_body: IIT Bombay has come up with a study where it has suggested measures to prevent water flooding, especially on Mumbai's railway tracks during monsoon. The study has recommended sewer systems and underground water holding ponds to prevent flooding. Notably, the mitigation assessment was conducted in Dadar, Lower Parel and Kurla areas of the city to understand the issue.

313.title: You can't say opener can't bat in different roles: Shan on Babar Azam's comment
313.article_body: Reacting to captain Babar Azam's remarks that he's a top-order batter and it would be "unfair" to play him in the middle-order in ODIs, Pakistan batter Shan Masood said, "An opener plays cricket in all phases." He added, "You can't say [opener] doesn't know how to bat in different roles." Shan wasn't included in their squad for West Indies ODIs.

314.title: Congress is making huge drama: BJP on Rahul, Sonia's ED summons
314.article_body: BJP National Spokesperson Sambit Patra on Sunday accused Congress of making a "huge drama" about Sonia Gandhi and Rahul Gandhi's respective summons to Enforcement Directorate (ED) with regard to National Herald Case. "Present yourself in front of ED and accept the wrongdoing...Rahulji, don't try to escape the rule," Patra said. Rahul Gandhi is slated to appear before the ED tomorrow.

315.title: Don't know if we can keep our bathrooms open to non-customers: Starbucks CEO
315.article_body: Starbucks CEO Howard Schultz recently said the company is considering ending its open bathroom policy. Citing safety concerns, he said the coffee giant might no longer allow people who are not customers to use their stores' bathrooms. "We have to harden our stores and provide safety for our people...I don't know if we can keep our bathrooms open," Schultz added.

316.title: Chhetri, Samad's goals give India win over Afg by 2-1 in AFC qualifiers
316.article_body: India defeated Afghanistan by 2-1 in the AFC Asian Cup qualifiers in Kolkata on Saturday. The two goals for India were scored by skipper Sunil Chhetri and midfielder Sahal Abdul Samad. At the end of 90 minutes, the scoreline was 1-1 before Samad scored a goal in the extra time. Notably, India will play against Hong Kong on June 14.

317.title: 5-yr-old boy out for walk with sister in Maha attacked by dogs, dies
317.article_body: A five-year-old boy, who had stepped out of his home for a walk with his sister in Maharashtra's Nagpur, was attacked and killed by stray dogs, reports said. Reports added that while the boy's sister tried to shoo the dogs away, they dragged him to a construction site, where he was mauled to death.

318.title: 3 die due to heat at religious festival in Bengal, CM condoles deaths
318.article_body: Three devotees died due to heat and humidity during the 'Danda Mahotsav' at the ISKCON temple in West Bengal's Panihati. North 24 Parganas District Magistrate said the situation is under control. Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee condoled the deaths and said that all help is being provided to people on the spot.

319.title: Villagers in Thane oppose acquisition of land for Mumbai Metro carshed
319.article_body: Villagers from Thane's Bhayander region have opposed acquisition of their cultivable lands for construction of Mumbai Metro Line 9's carshed. About 300 property owners and their kin will be affected by the acquisition, said Bhumiputra Samajik Samanvay Sanstha President Ashok Patil. Government authorities want to acquire villagers' land instead of a privately held plot in the vicinity, Patil said.

320.title: Britain's Queen Elizabeth becomes world's 2nd-longest ruling monarch
320.article_body: Britain's 96-year-old Queen Elizabeth II on Sunday overtook Thailand's King Bhumibol Adulyadej to become the world's second-longest reigning monarch in history. The UK has been celebrating the Queen's Platinum Jubilee to mark 70 years since her coronation in 1953. France's Louis XIV remains the longest-ruling monarch with a 72-year reign from 1643 to 1715.

321.title: How much did the previous IPL media rights cost?
321.article_body: Sony Pictures Networks India had held the media rights for the first 10 years of IPL (2008 to 2017), for which it paid about ₹8,200 crore. Star India had won the IPL media rights for 2018 to 2022 cycle for ₹16,347 crore. The BCCI has set the reserve price at ₹32,890 crore for the 2023-27 cycle of the IPL.

322.title: Address being shared, family has threat from Islamic fundamentalists: Naveen
322.article_body: The Bharatiya Janata Party's leader Naveen Jindal who was expelled after his remarks on Prophet, took to Twitter to say his family faces threat from Islamic fundamentalists. "It is my humble request to everyone...do not share any kind of information about me and my family members with anyone...many people are posting my residence address on social media," the tweet read.

323.title: Video shows reversing car running over a 2-yr-old twice in TN; boy survives
323.article_body: A two-year-old boy has survived after being run over by a reversing car twice within seconds near Tamil Nadu's Rasipuram on Saturday. A video of the incident shows the boy playing on the street at the time of the incident. Police said the boy suffered fractures and his intestine was damaged in the incident.

324.title: Got scared after watching Big Brother, thought I'll be eliminated: Shilpa
324.article_body: Actress Shilpa Shetty, who participated in 'Big Brother', said that she initially got scared about the show. "I saw a couple of episodes and I got scared with what I saw. I said, 'I am not going to do all of this'," she added. "I honestly felt like I'll go, and I'll get eliminated in the second week," Shilpa said.

325.title: Rural development began when PM Modi came to power in 2014, says Shah
325.article_body: Union Minister Amit Shah said the aspect of rural development is to make villages convenient. "Gandhi Ji had said country’s soul resides in villages. Thus, if you’ve to make this country complete and independent, you’ll have to do it for the villages. This (rural development) began when PM Modi came to power in 2014," Shah added.

326.title: MP milkman, wife kill son, die by suicide; daughter survives incident
326.article_body: A milkman and his wife killed their son in Madhya Pradesh before also killing themselves. Reports said that they also tried to kill their daughter who survived the incident. The man's brother said that he was in distress due to abetment of suicide case on him and other members of the family.

327.title: NCB seizes 4.8 kg of charas from water purifier in Mumbai, 2 held
327.article_body: The Narcotics Control Bureau (NCB) in Mumbai has seized 4.88 kg of charas concealed in a special cavity made inside a water purifier, an official said on Sunday. The water purifier was to be sent to Australia through a courier service, the official added. The NCB has apprehended the consignor and a courier agent on Saturday, the official further said.

328.title: Exxon made more money than God this year: US President amid high oil prices
328.article_body: US President Joe Biden accused the US oil industry and Exxon Mobil of capitalising on high oil and gas prices as inflation soared to a 40-year high in the country. He said, "Exxon made more money than God this year." He added that US oil companies are not using higher profits to drill more but to buy back stocks.

329.title: Fake Satyagrah of fake Gandhis: BJP's Sambit Patra ahead of Rahul's ED date
329.article_body: A day before Congress leader Rahul Gandhi is scheduled to appear before ED, BJP's Sambit Patra said Congress is making "a huge drama" out of it. "Why this drama of press conferences…What is this Satyagrah? Gandhiji would be shamed to see this fake Satyagrah of fake Gandhis," Patra added. "Rahulji, don't try to escape the rule," he stated.

330.title: PM to inaugurate Sant Tukaram temple in Pune, security tightened
330.article_body: Security has been tightened for PM Narendra Modi's visit to Pune on June 14, during which he will inaugurate the Sant Tukaram temple. The entry of the devotees into the Sant Tukaram temple will be allowed in a restricted manner on Sunday and Monday and it will be barred on Tuesday, the trustees said.

331.title: Ruturaj's strike rate in first 10 balls is very low, that's a problem: Aakash
331.article_body: Commentator Aakash Chopra has said Ruturaj Gaikwad's strike rate at the start of his innings is a "problem" for India in the T20Is against South Africa. "Gaikwad goes at a strike rate of 80-90 in the first 10-12 balls. After that, if he plays a big knock then fine, else he pegs you back a little bit," explained Aakash.

332.title: Hyd Police arrest 3 for cheating people of ₹8 cr in govt scheme scam
332.article_body: Hyderabad's Ghatkesar Police along with Malkajgiri Special Operations team (SOT) have arrested three persons who were absconding in a cheating case. The accused would reportedly target people belonging to SC, ST and OBC communities, for whom government has introduced various welfare schemes. The accused had allegedly collected ₹8 crore from people in guise of 'deposits' for the beneficiary amount.

333.title: High time PM breaks silence on rising Islamophobic cases: Tharoor
333.article_body: Congress leader Shashi Tharoor on Sunday said it is high time PM Narendra Modi breaks his silence on the proliferation of Islamophobic incidents in the country. Tharoor's comments came following controversial remarks on Prophet Muhammad by two BJP leaders. "I think our current hate speech laws and Section 295A are quite adequate to deal with such misbehaviour," Tharoor said.

334.title: $5 trillion GDP goal appears to be case of shifting goalposts: Chidambaram
334.article_body: Former Union Minister and Congress leader P Chidambaram said that the BJP-led Centre's "goal of a $5 trillion GDP appears to be a case of shifting goalposts". "The original target year was 2023-24...We are nowhere near that goalpost," Chidambaram said. He added, "Now, the Chief Economic Adviser has said we will achieve the goal by 2027."

335.title: Chhattisgarh BJP leader booked over alleged 'fake' coal theft video
335.article_body: Chhattisgarh BJP Secretary Om Prakash Choudhary was booked on Saturday following a complaint alleging that the coal theft video he posted was "fake". The purported video, which went viral, showed people digging and carrying away coal from an opencast coal mine in Korba. The District Collector had "accepted that coal theft was going on", Choudhary said reacting to the FIR.

336.title: France holds first round of parliamentary elections on Sunday
336.article_body: The first round of the parliamentary elections is taking place in France on Sunday. President Emmanuel Macron, who recently won the presidential election, is seeking a majority for his coalition in the National Assembly. More than 6,000 candidates are in fray for 577 seats in the National Assembly. The second and final round will be held on June 19.

337.title: Top 10 most valued firms lose ₹2.29 lakh cr in m-cap in past week
337.article_body: The top 10 most valued firms lost ₹2.29 lakh crore in market capitalisation (m-cap) in the past week, with LIC taking the biggest hit after losing ₹57,272.85 crore in m-cap. LIC was followed by Reliance Industries, which witnessed a fall in m-cap of ₹44,311.19 crore, and Hindustan Unilever Limited, losing ₹21,674.98 crore in m-cap. Reliance remains India's most valued firm.

338.title: 22 injured as missiles hit military facility in Ukraine: Governor
338.article_body: As many as 22 people were injured after missiles destroyed a military facility in Ukraine's Chortkiv, said Volodymyr Trush, Governor of the Ternopil region, on Sunday. "All missiles were from the Black Sea. A military facility and civilian facilities were partially destroyed," he said. Four apartment buildings had been damaged in the attack, he added.

339.title: Thousands of sheep drown as overladen ship sinks off Sudan's coast
339.article_body: An overladen ship crammed with thousands of sheep capsized on Sunday off Sudan's Red Sea coast drowning the animals on board but with all crew surviving, port officials said. The livestock vessel was heading from Sudan's port of Suakin to Saudi Arabia. "It was carrying 15,800 sheep, which was beyond its load limits," an official said.

340.title: Combined bid for IPL TV and digital rights crosses ₹40,000-crore mark: Reports
340.article_body: The combined bid for IPL TV and digital rights has crossed the ₹40,000-crore mark, as per reports. With this, the media rights value of the league has more than doubled as compared to 2018-2022 media rights value that was won by Star India for ₹16,347 crore for TV and digital rights. The winners will be announced on Monday.

341.title: Heatwave to reduce in 4 states/UTs; IMD releases list
341.article_body: The India Meteorological Department has predicted that heatwave conditions will continue in isolated pockets over Punjab, Haryana, Delhi and southeast Uttar Pradesh during next two days, but will reduce after that. Heatwave conditions are also likely over east Uttar Pradesh, Himachal Pradesh, Uttarakhand on June 12 and 13 and in Jammu division on June 12.

342.title: Chhattisgarh boy stuck in borewell for over 45 hrs, rescue op underway
342.article_body: The rescue operation is underway to get an 11-year-old boy out of a borewell in Chhattisgarh even after over 45 hours. The boy is conscious, officials said. The boy fell into the 80-feet-deep abandoned borewell in the backyard of his house in the Janjgir-Champa district of the state on Friday.

343.title: India beat Olympic champions Belgium in shootout at Men's Pro Hockey League
343.article_body: Goalkeeper PR Sreejesh saved a penalty stroke in the shootout as India defeated Olympic champions Belgium 5-4 in first match of the two-legged FIH Men's Pro Hockey League on Saturday. India were down 1-3 with just eight minutes left in the match but held Belgium 3-3 to force a penalty shootout. Sreejesh was adjudged 'Player of the Match'.

344.title: Govt setting up communication with minorities to hear their problems: UP minister
344.article_body: UP minister Danish Azad Ansari said the state government is starting 'Qaumi Chaupals' in the state to set up communication with the minorities and hear their problems. "Started 'Qaumi Chaupal' to create awareness about schemes for minorities on the ground level," Ansari added. "We're setting up communication with them so we may also hear their problems," he stated.

345.title: BMC tells residents to take precautions amid rising malaria cases
345.article_body: The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) has asked residents to take precautions against malaria amid a rise in cases in Mumbai. In the first five days of June, the city has reported 57 cases of malaria and 10 cases of dengue. Notably, the city had reported 950 malaria cases and 94 dengue cases until June 5 this year.

346.title: You took it personally to heart: Moeen to Cook over viral on-air clash in January
346.article_body: Referring to their on-air clash that went viral in January, Moeen Ali told Alastair Cook, "You took it personally to heart." Moeen said, "I was basically saying that Joe Root had a lot more empathy for players than you did and I never mentioned once that you're not a good captain or if you are or aren't better than Root."

347.title: IPL generates more revenue than English Premier League: Sourav Ganguly
347.article_body: BCCI President Sourav Ganguly, in a recent event, said that IPL generates more revenue than English Premier League. "I’ve seen the game evolve...where players like me earned a few hundreds and now have the potential of earning crores," Ganguly said. He added, "It makes me feel happy and proud that the sport I love has evolved to become so strong."

348.title: IAS officer scolded by HC judge over dress code, asked 'Is this a cinema hall?'
348.article_body: A video showing a Bihar IAS officer being scolded by a Patna High Court judge during a court hearing has been widely shared online. "You don't know in what dress code you've to appear in the court?...Do you think this is a cinema hall?" Justice PB Bajanthri is heard asking Bihar Principal Secretary for Housing and Urban Development Anand Kishor.

349.title: 295 Maoist sympathisers, militias surrender in Odisha: Police
349.article_body: The Odisha Police said 295 active Maoist militias, Maoist sympathisers, members of the local village committee and members of the Maoist frontal organisations surrendered before police in Malkangiri. "The villagers who surrendered were involved in several exchanges of fire, arson cases, civilian killings, hoisting of black flags instead of national flag and burning of vehicles," an official said.

350.title: Illegal liquor vend busted in Gurugram, 1 arrested
350.article_body: An illegal liquor vend was busted in Gurugram and one person was arrested, police said on Saturday. The excise department and the Chief Minister's flying squad, acting on a tip-off, conducted a joint raid and seized a large quantity of liquor, police added. An FIR has been registered against the owners at Manesar Police Station, they added.

351.title: PM's silence is baffling: Chidambaram on ex-BJP leaders' Prophet remarks
351.article_body: Congress leader P Chidambaram has criticised PM Narendra Modi over the alleged remarks against Prophet Muhammad by former BJP leaders, saying, "The PM's silence is baffling, but in tune with his silence on past occasions." Moreover, on being questioned about foreign countries condemning the remarks, he replied that the PM should have "spoken and acted immediately after the offensive utterances".

352.title: Noida authority razes 27 farmhouses built on Yamuna floodplains
