352.article_body: Noida authority on Saturday demolished 27 farmhouses built illegally in an area of 15 hectares on the Yamuna floodplains, officials said. The land is worth around ₹60 crore and is located in villages like Nagla Nagli and Nagli Wajidpur in Sector 135, they added. More such illegal constructions will be razed soon, said Noida authority's OSD (Land) Prasun Dwivedi.

353.title: India should play first 3 T20Is vs SA with same team: Ashish Nehra
353.article_body: Ex-India fast bowler Ashish Nehra said Team India should play with the same playing XI in the first three T20Is against South Africa unless there is a "drastic change" in conditions. He stated Cuttack also has a high-scoring pitch. "India should learn from the defeat in the first game and move to the second one without panicking much," Nehra stated.

354.title: 5 killed after truck hits car, bike in Rajasthan's Jhalawar
354.article_body: Five people were killed and two got injured after a container truck collided with a car and a bike near Akodia village of Rajasthan's Jhalawar district. The truck collided with the car first and then hit the bike-borne three youths 50 metres ahead, police said. Out of the five deceased, three on bike were college students aged between 20-22 years.

355.title: BJP MLA shares video of police beating 9 men with sticks in UP, calls it 'return gift'
355.article_body: After protests over ex-BJP leader Nupur Sharma's remarks, BJP MLA Shalabh Mani Tripathi has shared a video of police beating up nine men with sticks and wrote, "Return gift for rioters." The video shows the men crying in pain as police beat them in what seems to be a police station. Meanwhile, SP chief Akhilesh Yadav condemned the act.

356.title: 7 govt doctors put on duty to treat DM's sick cow in UP's Fatehpur
356.article_body: The Chief Veterinary Officer of Uttar Pradesh's Fatehpur, Dr SK Tiwari, has directed seven veterinary doctors to treat the ailing cow of District Magistrate Apurva Dubey. In an official letter, the officer has directed the doctors to check the cow daily in the morning and in the evening. The order also mentions that any laxity will be unpardonable.

357.title: Ex-world no. 1 Murray reaches 1st final on grass in 6 years at Boss Open
357.article_body: Former world number one Andy Murray defeated Nick Kyrgios 7-6(7-5), 6-2 at the Boss Open in Stuttgart to enter his first tour-level final on grass in six years. The Brit won his semi-final in one hour 31 minutes. Unseeded Murray will face second-seeded Matteo Berrettini, who beat German Oscar Otte 7-6(9-7), 7-6(7-5), in the final on Sunday.

358.title: Will get into the mind of Dhoni if I get mind reading power: Karthik
358.article_body: During an interaction for BCCI, wicketkeeper-batter Dinesh Karthik said he would get into the mind of ex-India captain MS Dhoni if he gets the ability to read minds. On being asked to choose between Lionel Messi and Cristiano Ronaldo, Karthik said, "Messi, I think he is slightly different and I enjoy watching him in the little that I have watched."

359.title: I enjoy intimacy, don't have to keep it a secret at my age: Imtiaz on 'She'
359.article_body: Filmmaker Imtiaz Ali, while speaking about turning intimacy director for his upcoming series 'She', said that like every Indian, he enjoys intimacy. "I am at an age where I don't have to keep my interest in intimacy a secret," Imtiaz added. He also said that there is a lot of potential dramatically in intimacy.

360.title: Hyd Police nab 3 interstate drug traffickers; seize MDMA, cocaine
360.article_body: Hyderabad's Rachakonda Police on Thursday arrested three drug traffickers on the outskirts of Choutuppal and seized narcotic substances, including cocaine and MDMA pills, and ₹60,000 cash from them. The accused, who are part of an interstate drug syndicate supplying contraband substances from Goa to Andhra Pradesh, were caught following a tip-off. One of the accused is yet to be arrested.

361.title: Foreign investors withdraw net ₹14,000 crore in 8 days in June
361.article_body: Foreign portfolio investors (FPIs) have withdrawn ₹14,000 crore from Indian equity markets in eight trading sessions in June. With this, the total net outflow by FPIs so far this year has reached ₹1.81 lakh crore, data with depositories showed. FPIs sold net ₹40,000 crore from Indian equity markets in May, ₹17,144 crore in April and ₹41,123 crore in March.

362.title: Shraddha's makeup artist gets injured on sets of Luv Ranjan's film in Spain
362.article_body: Actress Shraddha Kapoor’s makeup artist, Shraddha Naik, injured her leg on sets of Luv Ranjan’s film in Spain. Taking to Instagram, Naik shared a video from the shoot and revealed that she suffered a ligament tear and was put in a cast for 10 days. Alongside it, she wrote, "They said 'Break a leg in Spain' I took it seriously."

363.title: 'Spider-Man: No Way Home' extended cut to release in US on Sept 2
363.article_body: Tom Holland's 'Spider-Man: No Way Home' extended cut will receive a theatrical release in US and Canada on September 2. The film's official Twitter handle announced, "Spider-Man: No Way Home: The More Fun Stuff Version swings into movie theatres in the US...Canada September 2! More countries to be announced soon!" The film also features Tobey Maguire and Andrew Garfield.

364.title: Each one of us has a role to play to end child labour: Ayushmann
364.article_body: On World Day Against Child Labour, actor Ayushmann Khurrana has said, "Each one of us has a role to play to end child labour." Ayushmann is UNICEF's celebrity advocate for the Ending Violence Against Children campaign. "Children belong in schools and playgrounds, not workshops, factories, agricultural fields or as domestic labourers," he added.

365.title: Ex-Barcelona footballer Prince marries Italian model on Moon in metaverse, pics surface
365.article_body: Former Barcelona footballer Kevin Prince Boateng, commonly known as Prince, married Italian model Valentina Fradegrada on Moon in the metaverse. "I wanted to do something special for Valentina, something that nobody had ever done. Thanks to OVER, we can celebrate our love like no one has done before, in a space location," Prince had earlier said.

366.title: US-based electric scooter startup fires 23% of its employees
366.article_body: US-based electric scooter startup Bird has fired 23% of its employees. Bird reportedly told a website that it has a headcount of about 600 people, meaning almost 140 employees will be affected. The layoffs will range from senior managers to new hires, said a Bird spokesperson. In 2020, Bird had fired 30% of its workforce on a Zoom call.

367.title: Chemical thrown on woman allegedly raped by Raj minister's son, told to drop case: DCW
367.article_body: The 23-year-old woman who had accused Rajasthan minister Mahesh Joshi's son of rape in Jaipur and Delhi was attacked with a chemical by some "unidentified persons", the Delhi Commission for Women (DCW) told police. "They...threatened her to withdraw her rape case," said DCW. The woman alleged that the accused persons told her 'This is just a trailer', during the attack.

368.title: Names, addresses asked before killing, how to live safely: Kashmiri Pandit
368.article_body:
While talking about the recent killings in Kashmir, a Kashmiri Pandit, as quoted by The Quint, said,
"We have seen minority killings earlier too, but this time, militancy has taken the form of targeted killings. They ask for names and addresses before killing. How can we live safely there?" He added he fears to be killed while sitting in office.

369.title: Binny Bansal sells 0.72% stake in Flipkart worth ₹2,060 crore to Tencent: Report
369.article_body: Flipkart Co-founder Binny Bansal has sold a 0.72% stake in Flipkart to China-based tech conglomerate Tencent through its European subsidiary, PTI reported citing official documents. The stake is valued at $264 million (over ₹2,060 crore) as per Flipkart's last valuation of $37.6 billion. The transaction was reportedly completed last year, and disclosed to the government in current financial year.

370.title: BA.5 sub-variant of Omicron detected in 37-year-old man in Pune
370.article_body: A 37-year-old man from Pune has tested positive for BA.5 sub-variant of Omicron. The man has been fully vaccinated and he returned from England on May 21. "The patient, who had mild symptoms, was diagnosed with COVID-19 on June 2 and cured after being in home isolation," Maharashtra surveillance officer Dr Pradeep Awate has said.

371.title: Man going to Golden Temple with family shot dead in Amritsar
371.article_body: A man was allegedly shot dead in Punjab's Amritsar on Sunday while he was going to visit the Golden Temple with his wife and two children. The victim, identified as Harinder Singh, had returned from Dubai, where he worked, just five days ago. His wife said that the attackers tried to snatch their valuables which led to a scuffle.

372.title: Sonia Gandhi hospitalised in Delhi over COVID-related issues
372.article_body: Congress' interim President Sonia Gandhi has been admitted to Sir Ganga Ram Hospital in Delhi due to issues related to COVID-19, party spokesperson Randeep Singh Surjewala said. "She's stable and will be kept at the hospital for observation," he added. Earlier, the Enforcement Directorate had issued fresh summons to Sonia Gandhi to appear before it for questioning on June 23.

373.title: Crypto market value declines to $1.1 trillion as Bitcoin drops to $27,000 level
373.article_body: The value of global crypto market declined more than 8% to $1.1 trillion as major cryptocurrencies traded in the red on Sunday. Bitcoin, the largest crypto by market value, fell 6.29% to $27,454, whereas Ethereum plunged as low as $1,450, its lowest level since March 2021. The decline comes after US inflation hit a 40-year high of 8.6% in May.

374.title: Hardik can score 70-80 in 30 balls, send him ahead of Pant: Chopra
374.article_body: Former India cricketer Aakash Chopra has said that all-rounder Hardik Pandya has the ability to score 70-80 runs off 30 deliveries. "I feel you should send Hardik...whenever a wicket falls after the 10th-12th over," Chopra said. "If you give Hardik 30 balls...he is going to give you a 70 or 80...You can send him ahead of Rishabh Pant," Chopra added.

375.title: It's just unbelievable what Rafael Nadal has achieved: Roger Federer
375.article_body: Tennis player Roger Federer praised Rafael Nadal after the latter won the 14th French Open title.  "It's just unbelievable what Rafa has achieved. The record of Pete Sampras, which I beat, was 14 Grand Slam titles. Now Rafa has won the French Open 14 times," Federer stated. "I was happy for him that he did it again," he added.

376.title: Philippine Defense Secretary faints during Independence Day event
376.article_body: Philippine Defense Secretary Delfin Lorenzana on Sunday morning fainted during an Independence Day ceremony at Rizal Park. He later shared a picture of himself at a hospital saying, "My lack of rest and sleep from my recent...international security engagements may have taken its toll...I'm fine now." Delfin was advised to rest following the incident, Defense spokesperson Arsenio Andolong said.

377.title: Stuart Broad shares pic of major fire at his pub, says 'Not sure I still can believe it'
377.article_body: England fast bowler Stuart Broad took to Instagram to share picture of major fire at his pub. He wrote, "I couldn’t believe the news...Not sure I still can." He added, "Thankfully no one was hurt, the Nottinghamshire Fire Service were incredible in their efforts & thank you to the villagers for the wonderful support & sorry for the disruption."

378.title: AAP announces new Gujarat unit, Kishorbhai Desai named state chief
378.article_body: Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) on Sunday announced the new office-bearers for its Gujarat unit. Kishorbhai Desai has been named as the State President, while Manoj Sorathiya has been appointed as State General Secretary. The party also appointed Gujarat leader Isudan Gadhvi as the National Joint General Secretary and Indranil Rajguru as the National Joint Secretary.

379.title: Demolition of 'illegally constructed' house of Prayagraj violence accused underway
379.article_body: Demolition of the "illegally constructed" residence of Prayagraj violence accused Javed Ahmed is underway. The move came after Prayagraj Development Authority (PDA) earlier put a demolition notice at the residence. News agency ANI reported that heavy security force has been deployed in front of Ahmed's residence. The PDA had asked him to vacate the house by 11 am today.

380.title: That was an unbelievable knock by Dasun Shanaka: Aaron Finch
380.article_body: After Sri Lanka chased down 59 runs in the last three overs in the third T20I, Australia captain Aaron Finch praised Sri Lanka skipper Dasun Shanaka's knock. "That was an unbelievable knock by Dasun tonight...I don't think our choice of batting first today had any reason for the defeat," he stated. Dasun smashed 25-ball 54 runs in the match.

381.title: Ready to play for Eng Test side if McCullum wants me in it: Moeen Ali
381.article_body: English all-rounder Moeen Ali has opened up to the idea of coming out of retirement from Test cricket and represent the English Test side. "When, or if, (England head coach) Brendon McCullum wants me, I'll play in Pakistan. I have played Pakistan Super League out there a few years ago," Ali said. Notably, England will tour Pakistan in November-December 2022.

382.title: UP groom leaves mandap for drinking water, runs from wedding over no dowry
382.article_body: A groom who was getting married among 144 couples in a mass-wedding event ran away from the wedding after he did not get dowry he wanted, reports said. Reports added that the groom had left the 'mandap' on pretext of going to drink water. When he did not return, massive search was reportedly initiated but he could not be traced.

383.title: Stop wearing 'I work long hrs, have no time for family' as a badge of honour: Namita
383.article_body: Emcure Pharmaceuticals' Executive Director and Shark Tank India judge Namita Thapar took to Twitter to talk about work-life balance. She wrote, "Stop wearing 'I work long hours, I travel a lot, I have no time for family' as a badge of honour. Let's fix work-life balance at all companies so we have a mentally fit and more productive generation next."

384.title: Hardik extremely versatile, you can play him at no. 4 and no. 6 as well: Bangar
384.article_body: Ex-India batting coach Sanjay Bangar has called all-rounder Hardik Pandya an "extremely versatile" player, who can be used in multiple roles by the team. "Hardik has worked very well on his game's foundation. You can play him at number four and at number six as well," Bangar added. Hardik scored 31*(12) in the first T20I against South Africa.

385.title: Woman attacked with blade for resisting eve-teasing in Bhopal, gets 118 stitches on face
385.article_body: A 32-year-old woman was attacked with a blade for resisting eve-teasing by three men and slapping one of them in Bhopal which led to 118 stitches on her face. The woman's one eye is not opening and she's not even able to speak, police said. Madhya Pradesh CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan said stringent action will be taken against the accused.

386.title: Rebranded McDonald's outlets open in Russia, renamed 'Vkusno & tochka'
386.article_body: The first 15 rebranded restaurants of former McDonald's reopened in Russia on Sunday under the name 'Vkusno & tochka', which means "Tasty & that's it". The new owner had recently unveiled their logo which featured two french fries and a burger. In May, McDonald's shut its business in Russia after 30 years of operation over the Ukraine war.

387.title: B'luru records 87% rise in new COVID-19 cases in 7 days with 545 cases
387.article_body: The number of new COVID-19 cases recorded in Bengaluru rose by about 87% in the last seven days as 545 new cases were reported on Saturday, according to BBMP data. The city had recorded 291 new cases on June 5. Only one COVID-19 death was recorded during the period and the total active clusters remained above 10, the data showed.

388.title: 'More transmissible' Omicron BA.4 COVID-19 variant detected in Russia
388.article_body: The Omicron BA.4 variant of COVID-19 has been detected in Russia, the country's health watchdog Rospotrebnadzor's genome lab head Kamil Khafizov said. "A number of studies published recently have revealed that variants...BA.4 and BA.5 are a little bit more transmissible than...early forms of Omicron," he said. Currently, BA.2 variant and its sub-variant are dominant in the country, he added.

389.title: Don't want to close door to China, willing to engage: Taiwan
389.article_body: Taiwan Premier Su Tseng-chang has said the country has always had goodwill towards China. "As long as there is equality, reciprocity and no political preconditions, we are willing to engage in goodwill with China," he said. "Taiwan does not want to close the door to China," he added. He blamed China for using "means to oppress and treat Taiwan unreasonably".

390.title: Prominent leader of Shiv Sena to attend Oppn leaders’ meeting: Raut
390.article_body: Shiv Sena leader Sanjay Raut said a prominent leader of the party will take part in Opposition leaders’ meeting called by West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee, on June 15, instead of Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray. The decision comes as the CM will be in Ayodhya at that time, Raut stated. The meeting has been scheduled ahead of the Presidential poll.

391.title: One of the best T20I finishes, that was brutal hitting by Shanaka: Malinga
391.article_body: Ex-Sri Lanka pacer Lasith Malinga has praised Dasun Shanaka for his unbeaten 54-run innings against Australia in their third T20I in Pallekele. "One of the best T20I finishes I've ever witnessed. That was some brutal hitting [by Shanaka]," tweeted Malinga. Shanaka's knock helped Sri Lanka to chase down 59 runs in the last three overs and win by four wickets.

392.title: Cong, JD(S) have accepted BJP as 'A' team: Karnataka CM
392.article_body: After BJP won three out of four Rajya Sabha seats from Karnataka on Friday, CM Basavaraj Bommai has spoken about the opposition parties namely JD(S) and Congress. "We are not bothered as to who is the 'B' team...It means both the opposition parties have accepted that BJP is the 'A' team," CM Bommai said.

393.title: Won't outstay my welcome as England manager: Gareth Southgate
393.article_body: England head coach Gareth Southgate has said that he will not outstay his welcome as the football team's manager. "I think I can do a good job for the team, and...we have done a good job for the team," he stated. Southgate signed a contract extension in November last year and will remain England manager till 2024 end.

394.title: Power supply gets disrupted in Nepal after man climbs onto transmission line
394.article_body: Electricity production in Nepal's Nuwakot's hydro-electric plant was disrupted after a person climbed onto a power transmission line and has been clinging to it. The state electricity authority, Nepal Electricity Authority (NEA) was forced to shut down the power project. As per an NEA official, an average loss of around one million Nepalese Rupees has been incurred due to this.

395.title: Death knell for rule of law: Karti after buildings bulldozed in UP
395.article_body: After buildings of those accused of violence during protests over remarks on Prophet Muhammad were demolished in Kanpur and Saharanpur, Congress’ Karti Chidambaram said state-sponsored vigilante justice is the "death knell" for the rule of law. In Kanpur, parts of a building owned by businessman Mohammad Ishtiyaq, a relative of 'key conspirator' Hayat Zafar Hashmi, were demolished.

396.title: I would want South Africa to drop David Miller, jokes Bhuvneshwar Kumar ahead of 2nd T20I
396.article_body: Ahead of the second India-South Africa T20I, pacer Bhuvneshwar Kumar said, "It is difficult bowling to David Miller." He added, "He is in such good form. I would want South Africa to drop him but they would not do so." Bhuvneshwar stated, "He batted so well in the IPL, we know his calibre. Bowling to him would be a challenge."

397.title: Salman joins Kamal, Chiranjeevi at Vikram success party, pics surface
397.article_body: Pictures of actor Salman Khan with actors Kamal Haasan and Chiranjeevi at the success party of the film 'Vikram' have surfaced on social media. Chiranjeevi took to Twitter and shared the pictures and wrote, "Absolute joy, celebrating and honouring my dearest old friend Kamal for the spectacular success of 'Vikram' along with my dearest Sallu Bhai."

398.title: R Madhavan’s Rocketry trailer launched at Times Square, actor shares video
398.article_body: The trailer of actor R Madhavan's film 'Rocketry: The Nambi Effect' was screened at the NASDAQ Billboard at Times Square in New York. The actor took to Instagram and shared a video of the crowd at Times Square. The film is written, produced and directed by Madhavan, who also plays the lead role.

399.title: Trent Boult equals world record for scoring most runs at no. 11 in Test cricket
399.article_body: New Zealand pacer Trent Boult equalled the world record for scoring the most runs batting at number 11 in Test cricket. With his 16*(18), Boult took his tally of Test runs at number 11 to 623. He equalled former Sri Lanka off-spinner Muttiah Muralitharan's record. Boult scored 623 runs in 78 innings, while Muralitharan scored in 98 innings.

400.title: 19 lakh+ devotees undertook Char Dham Yatra since May 3: Temple Committee
400.article_body: The Badrinath-Kedarnath Temple Committee said that since the Char Dham Yatra began on May 3, over 19 lakh devotees have undertaken the journey. Reports said that 6,57,547 pilgrims reached Badrinath Dham From May 8 to June 11 evening, while 6,33,548 pilgrims have reached the Kedarnath Dham from May 6 to June 11 evening.
